Key Match Events: Gilgeous-Alexander made 14 of 19 shots to go along with seven assists, six rebounds and a team-high four blocks.
The Thunder led 76-50 at halftime behind 23 points from Gilgeous-Alexander and 12 each from Mitchell and Kenrich Williams.
Oklahoma City outscored the Grizzlies 42-19 in the second quarter to take control.
Oklahoma City went on a 32-9 run to extend the lead to 74-45 and put the game out of reach before halftime.
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 35 points and the Oklahoma City Thunder won their 11th straight game, beating the short-handed Memphis Grizzlies 130-106 on Sunday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder blocked nine shots, including three by center Isaiah Hartenstein.
Memphis played without star Ja Morant (shoulder) and Zach Edey, the teamâ€™s No. 9 overall draft pick, who was in concussion protocol.
